website_summaries.verdict: A premium DSLR camera case that is lightweight and easy to use.
pros: Offers plenty of room for a DSLR camera with a standard zoom lens
Equipped with multiple interior compartments to hold your camera lenses and accessories
Comes with padded adjustable dividers for added convenience
Single-strap backpack design ensures you can sling the case over your shoulder and carry it with you anywhere you go
cons: Shoulder strap tends to fall apart easily

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this bag. It fits my Canon EOS 7D perfectly. In the photo I uploaded, it has the 50mm lense and the 28-135mm on the right. I also have extra accessories, such as my Speedlite 430EXII, located in the top pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. I've been wearing it on my travels and it is very comfortable and easy to access on the fly. Divider system is not as well-designed as it could be but there is plenty of room for my camera and two lenses. And yes, it does fit with a 70-300mm lens attached to the camera!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Wood

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Canon camera
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Digital Canon and a few lenses that I love, and my old camera bag although in perfect condition was too bulky to haul around. The reason its in perfect condition is it never leaves the house. This one WILL leave the house and protect my expensive camera and lenses AND keep my hands free to take pics. I am so glad I no longer have to lay my carrying case down to take pics. It is perfectly balanced and therefore does not pull on my arms when taking photos. Great product great price.
customer_reviews.author: CLM

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money...kinda
customer_reviews.text: First impression...feels cheap. The straps, from experience with similar quality, feel like they'll break or get frayed and eventually break. The dividers don't feel soft or steady enough to protect equipment and worst of all it was missing Velcro on a spot, preventing me from using a divider. That's what you see in the photo. I'm sending it back. :/
customer_reviews.author: Specialized Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great! But...
customer_reviews.text: I like it! I've always worn a hip belt camera pack, then rotated it to the front to retrieve my camera. This is similar, but with the weight on my shoulder it allows me to hike with better endurance - I think. Anyway, it's made well and has almost enough room for all that I want to hike with: 80d, three lenses, extra batts, filters, bulb blower, lens cloth. UPDATE: careful of stitching for any of the straps. It pulls out or breaks easily. Only a slight problem but makes me afraid to lift and carry anything heavy and fragile!
customer_reviews.author: MrBass

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag but Not if You Have a Larger Lens Like a 70-300mm.
customer_reviews.text: While there is nothing actually wrong with this bag, its only good if you have small lenses. I have 3 lenses, the largest of which is 70-300mm and this bag is just not large enough to cater for it. I purchase with the intention of storing the larger lens in the top compartment, but it's too tight for my liking. The other option is to reconfigure the tabs and store the long lens in the main compartment but again everything appears just a little too tight, meaning that access is not that easy. If this bag were 1 inch wider it would be great but it's just a little too small for my requirements.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bird

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Bag I have ordered
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag for a Sony a 7s, with a 28-70 lens, a fixed lens, and a Rode wirless transmitter and receiver, and a shot gun micrphone. Everything fit as if custom mafe. The shotgun mic at the bottom compartment, the Rode TX and recever at the top, the fixed lens below that, and the camera and zoom in middle, Plus it has small compartments for batteries, cleaning cloth, and so forth. Couldn't have designed a better bag for the above euipement
customer_reviews.author: Richard Josephson

customer_reviews.title: Nice for price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack with no much higher expectations, but when arrived I love it. I wish was a little, just a little bigger but I made everything work. Recently I acquired new lenses and with my bf we love hiking, so I thought investing in a nice bag for the camera will be a good idea (I use to use something more similar to a purse and I always felt the lenses weren't safe, but now I do. The backpack is super comfortable and depending on your setting can fit 4 lenses and the camera or 3 and the camera and some other stuff. Really nice and a good price, super happy.
customer_reviews.author: Consuelo

customer_reviews.title: It could be better...
customer_reviews.text: The bag is great for quick outings with 2-3 lenses and a camera. The top compartment is good for a few things like cables and backup batteries. My main gripe about this bag is the quality of the zippers. Granted, they do work, BUT they always snag on the material surrounding them. You have to actually use two hands to open and close the bag. First world problems, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Becky with the Good Hair

customer_reviews.title: No for long term use ** updated**
customer_reviews.text: This product is okay if you have only one lens and the cMera body, the minute I added more weight, I got ripped. I won’t buy it again. ***UPDATE*** After I posted this review, the seller has contacted me and offered me either a refund or replacement. I thought it was an excellent customer support and decided to give it another shot, since the bag is the perfect size for my needs. I also should say the I purchased this bag a while ago, and they still offered the replacement. thanks for taking care of your customers. Pilar
customer_reviews.author: Pilar

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good bag for a small kit.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very similar to the LowePro Slingshot 102. It doesn't have the rain cover but, otherwise, is close. This would be great for a single DSLR and a couple of lenses and a flash, cables, cards, etc. It was a little small for my needs and I ended up giving this bag to a friend and ordered the LowePro Slingshot 202 which I'm hoping will fit my gear a little better. If you've got a smaller kit or just want something to take only a couple extra lenses out, I wouldn't hesitate to buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Ed W.

customer_reviews.title: Love the size and functionality but...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag for my Olympus OMD camera kit for a trip in August. I really love the bag and it worked really well for my trip. If I had written this review right after that trip it would have been a 5 star review. I have always had really good luck with this vendor (Goja) on everything I have ordered. Unfortunately since the trip the bag has had a seam fail. I could see how this seam could fail if the bag had been overloaded, but that is not what happened in this case. See my photo to see where the seam failed.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Just right for the go!!
customer_reviews.text: Great lil backpack is not to big or small, I think is just right for a a6000 or a6300, I can fit a camera with a lens and two other lenses if needed, and still got space for a flash, and a side pockets for a pod.
customer_reviews.author: G. J. JIMENEZ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - Great for my Nikon D5600
customer_reviews.text: This simple camera sling backpack is awesome. This neatly and securely fits my Nikon D5600, Nikon 70-300mm AF-P ED DX lens, Nikon 18-55mm AF-P DX VR and YONGNUO YN50mm F1.8N without any issues. I also store my battery charger, lens cleaning equipment and card reader and have more room to spare. This is adequately padded for protection of your gear and all the zippers and buckles are secure and nothing is lose. Highly recommend and this is comfortable to wear. Allows you to easily take your camera out to capture a shot at any moment.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera bag.  Great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made camera bag. It's not huge by any means but I can get my camera body with lens plus three other lenses in the main compartment. Then in the top compartment I store my flash and cleaning kit plus filters. One thing I don't like about it is I wish it had an additional zippable pocket on the front or side. You can never have enough storage on a bag. And the single main strap with separate strap to secure the bag around you waist/chest isn't very comfortable on me. It tends to ride up a bit rather than hang on your body. But it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: soak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This bag holds my canon t7i, 18-55mm, 55-250mm, and 50mm lenses with their hoods, 3 battery packs and charger, plus fliters with room to spare. Feels comfortable and secure. I recently used it on a canyoneering trip, this bag kept everything accessible and secure to my back, though next time I'll use something a little more rigid. The dividers inside are customizable, zippers and clasps work great. Great bag for the money.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hathcock

customer_reviews.title: very poor quality,, but easy access to equipment
customer_reviews.text: UPDDATED: after a couple of months of eventual use, the problems started. The seams began to loosen and the upper grip fell off and miraculously did not fall to the floor, breaking my camera and lenses. I had originally given it 5 stars but for the quality it showed in a very short time I lowered it. I do not recommend that you buy this backpack. Original : My d7500 nikon with two lenses and a flash come in perfect. It is easily accessible and the quality is very good. the only downside is that one of the clips was reversed and now it can't be unbuttoned.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian costa

customer_reviews.title: uhmmm, maybe not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I expected the bag to be a tad bigger (my issue since i didn't pay attention to the dimentions). it's a small bag and has a few compratments. sadly i have so many things to fit and i can't fit them all in. The only things that i didn't like about it is the one arm/sling , it wasn't very comfortable for me, maybe it would for someone else. as for water resistance it just doesn't seem very water resistant, i've been in rain and it sucked in some water (heavy rain)
customer_reviews.author: Yazzan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, convenient, but don't overstuff it!
customer_reviews.text: This bag was all that I expected and more. IT came in just in time to take it on a two-week Mediterranean cruise, and it held up very well. I've lugged it around almost daily, and have used it to carry my main camera, but at times, a second, smaller camera, as well as sundry accessories. Six months later, it is showing the effects of my perhaps rough handling/overstuffing - the outer fabric is coming apart at the seams, but the integrity is still intact. The main advantage is being able to sling it over the shoulder and swing it to get at the contents without having to take it off and fumble about.
customer_reviews.author: Felix FFDS

customer_reviews.title: Received a new Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple of months ago. On the third use it ripped on the main camera compartment as shown in the photo. It has a good design but not very good materials. 8/20/2019 Update: Goja (the distributor) send me a new and upgraded replacement version of this backpack, called the Wanderer series. It looks good and seems to be more durable than the one I purchased months ago. Hopefully I will have no issues with this one. Thank you Goja!
customer_reviews.author: Hernan

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky and stiff - could use an extra side pocket.
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is extremely well made. However, it's simply too bulky and stiff for me (5'3" female). I had hoped to use it for skiing, but can see it will push me forward on the lift chair. The idea is not to have to unclip and remove it. Since shipping is my responsibility, and I bought this bag on sale, it's not logical to send it back. I'll figure out if I can repurpose it, give it to a family member or locally resell it. If anyone knows of a good bag that is easy to use on a ski lift, or in public transportation, without taking it off - do let me know!!
customer_reviews.author: TVT_RoundTable

customer_reviews.title: Small, but nice
customer_reviews.text: This bag is very small, but I can't deduct a star for that since the dimensions are clearly listed. I had looked at them and still thought all my equipment (just a starter bundle I'd purchased with a Nikon D3400, two lenses and some basic accessories) would fit, but I was mistaken. I was going to return the bag since it can't hold everything, but it's so comfortable and easy to use I decided to keep it. It holds the very basics I use most often, and I can see myself carrying this bag to places I'd feel awkward lugging a bigger, bulkier backpack.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: This is an exceptionally well designed (ergonomically, and functionally) sling backpack - Buy It.....
customer_reviews.text: I love this sling backpack for carrying the basics (i.e., extra mirrorless body and lens, batteries, SD Cards, Flash Unit, and a dozen other items that I always want to have access to in the field. Fits well, minimal strain on my back even when fully loaded, and made of high quality material. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: sling style was great but quality was not.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag to take on a 1 week vacation. I liked the slim design and the sling for easy access to my camera while still wearing the bag. Unfortunately I had to return it because the fabric started to pull away from the zipper after using it for only a week. I ended up returning it to Amazon ( a little annoyed that they charged me a restocking fee on a defective item) and ordering a different brand that is a little bigger and has more features. Hope it lasts longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Carter

customer_reviews.title: It does what it’s supposed to do, but ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it means to do, however it’s pretty limited in capabilities. I mean, the interior variable compartments can’t really change direction due to where the Velcro fits, nor it can be adjusted in length. The material is somewhat cheap, but the product is priced accordingly. It’s not a bad product by any means, but if you are looking for something that can be adjusted due to the length of your Lena for example ... then look somewhere else. Overall, well made and it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Mariano Oliveti

customer_reviews.title: Overall the build is great, I wore for about 10 minutes to try ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give 5 stars but I thought that you could re-arrange the insides to fit differently as it was described in the add. There really is not much options to move anything around inside at all. Overall the build is great, I wore for about 10 minutes to try it out after I loaded everything in it. The extra zipper compartments are nice for sd cards and such. I am right handed and I felt a little weird as the strap goes over your left shoulder and I am not sure you can change this. I got use to it though. Seems sturdy and well built for the price. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: April B

customer_reviews.title: Very good value, what's with the gray strap over the zipper, though?
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bag... comfortable, holds stuff reasonably securely. I have a D750, 85mm, 50mm, and 20mm .. and a speedlight that all fit well. Any more than that it wouldn't work. I like that it doesn't look too fancy.. or at least doesn't have 'Nikon' on it really big. The only thing I don't like/understand is the stupid gray nylon strap in the middle. It's right over the main compartment and always in the way.. You can't get to the zipper and doesn't seem to serve any real purpose. I'm not sure what I'm going to do with the strap... but it keeps me from loving this bag.
customer_reviews.author: C. McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Good for Hobbyist and Good for active travelers
customer_reviews.text: Great Travel case. Bought for my Husband and our trip to France where we were going to have the Toddler in tow. With it being secured across the body it left the hands open for the toddler/shopping and you didn't have to worry about it swinging when you bent down or turned around. Only down side is that it's a soft case with no hard parts. I would have preferred a hard back piece and a harder top plate for the bangs and bumps that happen when traveling long distances. Not great for a professional person or a lot of lens, but good enough for a hobbyist and casual travel photos.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Batch

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe all of the stuff I fit in this backpack! (See my pics) I had a Corporate event I had to shoot and I was able to carry this around and shoot the event with ease while changing out my lens because of the handy zipper on the side. My flash diffuser just clipped on one of the loops. I also fit All of my personal items such as keys, cash, credit cards and lipstick in there as well. I got rid of my larger bulky backpack and I will only carry this one from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Missy310

customer_reviews.title: Easy to carry and not overbearing.
customer_reviews.text: I'd say i'm a minimalist because I really don't like to take too many things out with me, especially when I'm doing photography. This bag has enough room for everything I need and it still has some compartments left over. I really like the uniqueness of the side zipper for quick camera access. Over all great bag easy to use, customizable interior, quick access and over all a a good looking bag.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Smith

customer_reviews.title: MUCH SMALLER THAN EXPECTED.
customer_reviews.text: Products seems to be made properly. However it is much smaller than expected. Think of the picture and cut down by 1/3. Camera 80D does not fit in bag properly. Also dont even think about getting a big grip that most pro’s use. Definitely doesn’t fit properly in case. Top area is okay. Lense compacity once again is limited because size is so small. Really only can fit 2 50mm lenses and one med mm one in center pocket connected to camera
customer_reviews.author: Schio

customer_reviews.title: Great Sling Camera Case
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an easy case to use and carry so looked for one that was a sling type. Nice quality for the price and room for my new camera with a small telescope. Extra room for other lens, wallet, etc. Going to try and use on a few short bike rides into the country so I can take my better camera and get so long distance shots.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie H

customer_reviews.title: Really nice bag, outstanding service & warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first bag 2/19 for a trip. Worked great, travels well (easily meets airline carry on, underseat rules). I use this bag almost daily. Early 9/19 the top grab handle pulled loose. An email inquiry to Altura warranty, original order confirmation & 4 days later my replacemnt bag arrived. Jacqueline C. in their warranty department seemed to be waiting for my emails beacause she responded very quickly during business hours. I'll go back to Altura for delated products. The product would get a full 5 stars if it had a rain fly/cover. I carry a DSLR, 3 lenses
customer_reviews.author: MeMyself AndI

customer_reviews.title: I felt like a crazy person trying to put it on
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bag - very high quality, lots of room for storage. But I'll be quite honest -- I could not figure out how to put it on. It was so awkward to me, and it took my husband helping me to finally get it on correctly! It was not intuitive at all, and a few days later when I took it with me on a photo shoot for the first time, I had forgotten how to put it on again! My client actually had to help me :) HA! So, other than it being super awkward to put on, it's great. I'm sure I'll get used to it eventually.
customer_reviews.author: ashaugh28Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Just a few more inches larger and it would be perfect
customer_reviews.text: My Canon T6 will only fit with my 75-300 if I rearrange the dividers so I can place it in the center sideways without a lens. Kind of a pain because if I want to shoot I have to assemble my gear. I do like the slingability (is that a word?) of the pack and if I leave the 75-300 home there is ample room for the camera with my 50 on it, an extra lens and a few odds and ends, maybe even a sandwich.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Marino

customer_reviews.title: Love it, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of Urbex and Hiking. This bag is very convenient to carry and take the camera and lenses out of without taking the backpack off. I don't understand the complaints about durability I have no issues and the padding looks satisfactory. Gear in bag: Canon EOS 80D Canon EF-S 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 Image Stabilization USM Lens Canon EF 50mm f/1.8 STM Lens Canon EF-S10-18mm F4.5-5.6 IS STM Lens 3 Camera Filters in Individual Protective Cases 3 Camera Batteries Lens Cleaning Solution Lens Cleaning Wipes
customer_reviews.author: Aleks M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: Good camera bag. I held up during a 3 1/2 month camping road trip. It carries a lot of stuff: camera with lens, extra lens, filters, cleaning supplies, spare batteries, remote. And you can attach a tripod to the outside. I love how you can swing it around while you wear it, to grab your camera out quickly and easily, My only problem is that it's heavy to have hanging on just one shoulder and my right shoulder got very sore and tired. There is no way to switch to the other shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag!
customer_reviews.text: Update: Defective bag was replaced without issue. Really love the size of this bag and the functionality. Just received my bag today and I love it, but when I opened the box, I noticed the loop/handle at the top of it is already starting to tear/fray. Disappointing for being brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R.

customer_reviews.title: Great, but could use a minor adjustment for carrying the DJI Mavic Pro
customer_reviews.text: I got this because Amazon suggested it for my DJI Mavic Pro sUAV. while it does comfortably fit my quadcopter, the padded dividers were not intended for this configuration. It would be awesome if there was a better way to configure it to hold the drone, but as I said, it was intended for a DSLR camera. The bags quality is great. The bag is comfortable to wear and well worth the price. I would love to work with the manufacture to add a padding option that would work better with the DJI Mavic Pro, but I wouldn't tell you not to get this bag, for the propose of transporting your drone, it still works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Sentinel

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, fits a lot of gear.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to carry around, fits my T7i, 3 lenses (18-55, 55-250 and 50mm), my AP-C1001 flash with the triggers and accessories, my charger, extra memory cards, USB SD card reader and filters, along with my extension tubes for macro and the 3 hoods (installed backwards on the lenses).....and the tripod on the side. A little bit too bulky for my taste. Thought it was smaller, but carries a lot of stuff. Quality seems to be good., and the fact that you can turn it around and use the camera without taking the whole thing down is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last that long unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this bag with me on local trips around the city about 5 times and once internationally. So in about 6 uses on average, the top pocket zipper has failed me completely. The teeth wont connect and the zipper doesn't move now. Pretty much used as a a glorified storage back at home now. I used my regular jansport backpack prior to purchasing this and my backpack zippers still work perfectly after getting beat up over the years. I actually took good care of this bag and carefully opened and closed the zipper and it just breaks. Won't ever purchase again. I suppose you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: J-HA

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Lots of storage for my Canon Rebel and a couple of extra lenses, including a zoom lens, cables charger etc., (oh, and the tripod rig on the outside makes a good umbrella holder)
customer_reviews.author: MITCH IGAN

customer_reviews.title: Everything I Expected & More
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing . I literally would not switch from this product . Debating on purchasing another , one for travel and one for around the house . Holds everything that I need from stander , cleaners , extra lenses , extra chargers, etc. It presents great user control. As you can choose where you would like your stuff to go, meanwhile adjusting it , ensuring that your materials are safe.
customer_reviews.author: Vannah

customer_reviews.title: The right size and price, true value.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lowepro 200 slingbag that has become overloaded and heavy. I needed and wanted another slingbag to store and carry my older Nikon. The Altura Sling fit the bill for storage space and value. I now have my older Nikon DSLR with two prime lens, filters, extra batteries and few other things neatly kept in this bag for my photo outings. So far I like the bag and would recommend it ti anyone needing a small light weight sling for a day out shooting photos.
customer_reviews.author: Copykat

customer_reviews.title: Bag rips after little use
customer_reviews.text: This bag was purchased in June of 2019 as a replacement to the same bag which was stolen. This new bag was used very little and separated at the top in late December while on a trip. Attempted to contact seller, but unable to reach and Amazon stated no product support following 12/29. Unfortunate, I really liked this bag however, I would like for it to last longer than seven months. I do not recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: K_DUB77

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag was exactly what I needed. Fits my Nikon D300s, three lenses, the charging cord in the big pocket, and my GoPro with its attachments up top. Travels well. I even road my horse with it strapped on my back and it stayed secure the entire trip. Love this bag and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for run and gun fun
customer_reviews.text: Ive travelled all over the world with this bag. Ijs great on the plane and waking around a new city snapping pictures. I don't have to stop and take off the entire bags to access the contents. Changing a lens on the go is much easier with this bag. It's comfortable to wear and I can cram all of my essentials in there. Did i mention that I love purple! Not a replacement for your main gear bag but an excellent travel bag/ fanny pack replacement.
customer_reviews.author: NicoNoire

customer_reviews.title: heay carry bad
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter who was every so happy to get it. It looks like a nice item as it is easier to carry and lighter than the other camera bag she has which is so heavy and keeps all of her items well. This bag has a lot of nice pockets and opens in an easy manner so one could use it while it is on their body easily. I am not the camera buff that my daughter is but she was wild about this present.
customer_reviews.author: Norma R. Mills

customer_reviews.title: I was super happy with this bag for its size and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was super happy with this bag for its size and the ability to carry everything I need for a photoshoot. It can fit my Sony A6500 with a 35mm lens and a Canon 5D Mark iii + 24-70mm lens easily! Plus I put all my other stuff (portable light, some snacks, and portable phone charger in the other smaller compartment). This is def a must-have bag when you're shooting light or traveling! Also, there was some issues with the locks but the company sent me a new one right away. Amazing customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, Construction, and Materials
customer_reviews.text: I have the Amazon Basics camera backpack which I love but sometimes I don't want to be carrying around something that big. This smaller one is perfect for those days. I can fit in my Nikon, some extra lenses and filters with room for more. My tripod can be strapped to the side. It's well constructed from quality fabric and padding. I find the shoulder strap to be cimfortable, and he extra strap keeps the bag from flopping around while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: JaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice little backpack
customer_reviews.text: I like this backpack a lot. It's perfect for those times you don't need a lot of equipment. Just your camera and a few lenses. And a few accessories. Generously padded with a few zippered pockets. Very comfortable and really love the color too. I would definitely recommend. I haven't gone out in the rain with it yet. So not sure how it will fare. But i keep everything wrapped up anyway. So not really a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sánchez New York

customer_reviews.title: Not because it was made bad but i was looking for a bit larger bag
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this and had to return it. Not because it was made bad but i was looking for a bit larger bag. This bag would be perfect for a person with a single body and maybe two lenses on a day hike. If thats what i needed i would have kept it. For me i need something for outdoor portraits to carry multiple lenses and this just didnt fit the bill. The over build of this bad was solid, the colors are cool and tons of little storage pockets.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk S

customer_reviews.title: Broke after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly stitched. I was carrying it by it’s too loop. It only had a camera and 1 lens in the bag and the top loop stitching came undone one one side. If I didn’t have a good grip on it, the poorly padded case would have hit the floor. Not a safe purchase if you want to protect your camera
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Great compact way to carry your camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this bag. It is a little small if you are trying to carry multiple lenses but I have been able to fit my Canon and 2 extra lenses, cleaning kit, multiple filter sets and more all while having easy access to the things I need. The cases that come with your new camera are a waste, this should be the first purchase you make after getting a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Keenan Chance

customer_reviews.title: Dad's will love it.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for someone already carrying bags. I bring the diaper bag and this bag with me, and it fits comfortably. I don't even unhook the strap - I just slip my arm in and go! I've got my Canon T4i, battery grip, Canon 50mm, Canon 18-135mm, Sigma 17-50mm, and Tokina 11-16mm. This bag fits it ALL. I swap out stuff when I need my flash, but this is a nice and compact package. Wish it had a little thicker padding and stronger zippers, but it was a steal for about $23.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: Broken Zipper
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased it I thought it was a great sling-bag for my expensive camera. I've had it for about 9 months. During that time I used it very sparingly (for about an hour every couple of weeks). It's slowly started to come apart in small areas. Recently, after having used it for a full day, the zipper broke. I'm always ultra careful with my equipment (I baby it). This is a low quality sling-bag. It's just not going to last very long. If you use it for a full day it will probably break. I don't recommend using it to carry expensive camera equipment. Don't purchase this sling-bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Good bag but be very CAREFUL!
customer_reviews.text: It serves it's purpose although you have to be VERY careful, pay attention as you open the main compartment to remove items. On some of my shoot, several times, I almost dropped my lense out of the bag as I opened the compartment. This is a combination of being in a hurry and by design orientation of the bag. I think bag should have an elastic band that prevents the main compartment to flopped out so quickly, allowing contents to pour out.
customer_reviews.author: Tuan H.

customer_reviews.title: I like the options you have to configure the inside
customer_reviews.text: I like the options you have to configure the inside. I bought this specifically for a 14 day trip I was going on. It's not as friendly to maneuver as it appears to be in the picture. The clip to the main compartment & the side one that you'd use for your tripod didn't make it past the 2nd day of use they got stuck in locked position. I must say I am very pleased with their customer service dept who responded to me very quickly and made good on my purchase. Kudos to them! Good customer service is a dying breed. It's nice to know that there's a company out there that makes customer service a priority!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Its nice for a $30 camera bag. It works well for half day hikes, but I wish there was a pocket for a water bottle, which would really be nice. I'm a small(ish) woman and the thick straps are not designed for my body/chest. I do like the accessibility of the bag and I can carry my dslr, 2 lenses, a flash and my tripod and small snacks on my treks.
customer_reviews.author: TaiChi Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. I believe it is well made. I just have a couple of wants/wishes. First, my tripod was too big for the side pocket as shown in the picture. I’m not a professional, but that must be a tiny tripod. Also the Velcro layout is such that there really is no good way to reconfigure the layout beyond what is shown in the pictures. I wasn’t able to personalize the configuration to hold my components “well.”
customer_reviews.author: DrDR

customer_reviews.title: Concept is perfect for carrying your camera safely while hiking
customer_reviews.text: Concept is perfect for carrying your camera safely while hiking, for example. However, the sling strap is very wide on your shoulder, and is not comfortable for a woman. Also the straps can't get tight enough, so the minute one bends down the sling backpack flips to the front - negating the whole purpose. It seems to be designed for a man (as pictured). I didn't return it as there may be some use for it in my family. The construction of the pack and interior material is solid and appears to be well-made. Still looking for a similar item designed for women.
customer_reviews.author: Mktg-gal

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for Micro 4/3 (Mirrorless) cameras, just barely fits full size DSLR.
customer_reviews.text: Great little bag that's perfect for Micro 4/3 cameras. I -was- able to juuuuust barely fit my DSLR (Nikon D500), two lenses, a flash, a battery grip and a couple spare batteries, but it took a lot of careful space management and in the end I wound up getting a bigger bag for that camera. It can be done, but I'd go for at the very least the next size up for a full on DSLR setup. It very comfortably fits my Panasonic Lumix G3 and a bunch of accessories, though. It's well built and I trust it with my gear!
customer_reviews.author: Voss

customer_reviews.title: A great bag
customer_reviews.text: The bag is much roomier than I thought it would be. I can comfortably fit a Canon body w/short lens and a Mavic Pro with the controller and all chargers. The top part fits all of my accessories with no problem. The only gripe is the way it zips. There is a huge potential for dropping things out of it if you aren’t paying attention completely. Also, the cross body strap isn’t big boob friendly so all you ladies, heads up!
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Nice Backpack for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The Altura Photo Camera Sling Backpack for DSLR and mirrorless camera’s is very well made. It is light weight and easily holds the DSLR camera and two or three lenses. The 70-300mm zoom lens, I left on the camera in the bag, and there is plenty of room for two more lenses. (A lens that not too long) I would highly recommend this backpack if you’re hiking and need a light weight bag. You can work right out of the bag too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Woven Image

customer_reviews.title: one of my best buys
customer_reviews.text: i love this backpack, its not only great for my SonyA7iii but now i use it only for my 3 GoPros (yes i love GoPros and i have 3 of them) and all the accessories. its well made, compartments are good and i love the color. if you have a mirrorless camera with more than 3 lens then i don't recommend it. buy the medium backpack the same company sells, that's better if you have lots of gear cause this one is a small backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Bac

customer_reviews.title: Great construction. Just wish it was an inch or two wider.
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving this bag. I have a canon rebel t7i with 24mm lens attached and three additional lenses stored in it as well as an external flash and the lens filters and battery charger. It would be helpful if it was just a tad wider, and there were more options provided for placement if the padded separators in the main portion of the bag. Overall it JUST fits what I’m putting in there. Anything more added to my collection of lenses or equipment and it won’t fit.
customer_reviews.author: WKJones

customer_reviews.title: Stitches started to rip apart
customer_reviews.text: This is a review after 5 months owning this backpack and just found out that the stitching started to rip apart. I take care of my gear like a baby and for some reason the stitches aren’t holding up. I’ll be honest, if you looking for a budget backpack this would be perfect but if you looking for a durable backpack this isn’t the one and I’ll think twice.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this bag. The size, how it opened, the weight, the strap but I didn’t have a place to put my water bottle, cell phone or small wallet. I was sad to have to return it. If they added a water bottle pocket I would have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: red

customer_reviews.title: Handle has poor stitching
customer_reviews.text: When I received the bag, I was very pleased with the size of it. It was/is perfect for what I wanted to use on vacation with my camera equipment. What I packed in the bag was (1) Canon 5D Mark III, (1) Canon EF 600 Flash, (1) MagMod Sphere, (1) Canon Battery Charger and (2) cellphone charger cords. All fit perfectly into the bag. However, the handle on top, ripped within 4 days of use. Although this is not terribly important to me, I was disappointed because I was in love with the bag. Although I still intend to use it, I feel it's damaged goods and don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Licul

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Good bag. I wouldn’t call it military grade but, for the price, it seems to work fine. I’m aware of the negative reviews regarding build quality. For this reason, I avoid lifting the bag with the top handle and also put this bag into a larger backpack for transport. Overall, I’m satisfied with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Hexspa

customer_reviews.title: Good bag but
customer_reviews.text: Overall I think the body of this case is ok and works well with my Canon 80D camera. However, after only one trip for two weeks in Europe and with his first use, the upper grey hook strap totally frayed and broke away from the bag. Poor quality for the strap. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: hithere28

customer_reviews.title: IMPRACTICAL but Nice Looking
customer_reviews.text: CONS: Barely fit Nikon w/18-140 lens. Dividers are limited. Is impractical cuz of awkward way straps criss-cross front of body. Plastic clips & zippers are not durable if you plan to use over 2 to 3 times per year. And lastly... there's absolutely NO WAY you can twist bag around & take out camera while wearing. Not worth $34.99. PROS: Nice looking bag & lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaMarie113

customer_reviews.title: Good travel sling bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sturdy camera bag - it fit my Nikon D750 along with the 70-200mm, 24-70mm and the 14-24mm - it was a tight squeeze with the 70-200mm and the 24-70mm together but add a thin rag between the two lenses and you'll be fine I pulled out the separators to save space in the bag. I took this bag on a trip to Washington DC last week and it exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Steve751

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for a day with the camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a great addition to my camera equipment. Holds all the basics that I need to go shoot for the day. But do not expect it to hold all your camera gear. That is not what it is for. It is a pre-planned day bag for shooting. The only thing I wish is for more versatility in how I was able to set up the dividers. It is not that they don't work, they do very well. Just wish I had more of them or the ones it came with were more separated. But this is a comfortable and easy to use bag that let's keep with the kid or dog or whatever else I might be doing.
customer_reviews.author: wyomingpr

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag!
customer_reviews.text: This should hold my wife for a while. I gave her a Canon Rebel T7i for her birthday (yes, I'm quite a guy!) with an extra telephoto lens. This sling bag holds them easily, plus room for a third lens in the future. Holds her instructions manual and has a compartment for an external flash, if she purchases one in the future. Love this bag!
customer_reviews.author: mBrane

customer_reviews.title: Bag failed on first time used
customer_reviews.text: Used today for the first time on a visit to the Biltmore Estate. The bag worked fine when packing it but the zipper to the top compartment broke the very first time I tried opening it to remove my point-and-shoot camera. Very disappointed that I did not get a single use out of it before it failed. The only plus is that it failed now and not during an upcoming European vacation that it was purchased for. Of course, the 30 return warranty means I am stuck with a useless bag
customer_reviews.author: William L Radcliff

customer_reviews.title: Great sling bag !!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size sling bag. Not too big and not too small. Exactly what I was looking for. Enough room for camera, two extra lenses, extra battery, cell phone, and room to spare. Plus a strap for a lightweight tripod. I would recommend this to anyone looking for sling bag for walking around the city or hiking. Not too bulky when loaded with some gear. Very comfortable to wear. I would buy this again for a second setup of gear depending on what I'm photographing so I wouldn't have to swap out gear.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a smaller bag for my primary camera instead of carrying them all, all the time. This bag fits the bill. It's comfortable and I especially like that it's a sling that I can swing around to the front to grab the camera or change a lens! If you're on the fence, don't be, this is an excellent bag. I'm going to buy a second one for the other cameras so all I need to do is grab the right bag for the right application, or 'em both.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: I love the sling effect that this bag offers. There is lots of storage space for your camera, external flash unit, and at least 3 lenses. Also great for storing your memory cards, sync chords, extra batteries, lens caps, and camera cleaning supplies. I'm very happy with the purchase and I find the bag to look stylish.
customer_reviews.author: W. Deason

customer_reviews.title: A lot of bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: This bag is durable and well-made. There are enough pockets and loops to carry extra lenses, batteries, a tripod along with your camera. I had an older camera bag that was okay, but this has more room and is a little more stylish.
customer_reviews.author: GregL

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag but,  had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Great looking pack, seems to be nicely constructed. I didn't have a chance to test it for durability. Out of the box it was a bit smaller than I was expecting, which was fine, My Nikon D500 with a 70-300 lens fit nicely across the pack but with the battery grip the camera was too tall. I could have probably forced the flap over and got it zipped but that wasn't going to work very long for the camera or the pack. Other than that I liked the bag, but had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Layne H.

customer_reviews.title: Not made very well, l-shaped pads are a joke. Returned it.
customer_reviews.text: The L-shaped interior pads on the left and right are slanted in appearance when installed. In images and video, they're a really nice 90 degrees from the bottom to the sides. Either the velcro on the sides were placed low, or the L-pads are too long, which causes them to affix at an acute angle.﻿ It looks ugly and prevents the camera from being properly supported with the l-pads being at an odd angle. Poor craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Steven H

customer_reviews.title: Great bag! Easy camera access and good quality!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is great! Just took it on a missions trip to Nicaragua. My camera seems to fit somewhat loosely (like there's quite a bit more room for a larger camera). You can remove and move the cushion partition things in the main body, which is nice. I love having the upper section for items like money, phone, hand sanitizer, etc. It's a quick removal of the camera which is super nice...you don't have to totally take off the bag to access it. I owned a Lowepro just like it that I lent someone and they lost it. I was super happy to find this to replace it!
customer_reviews.author: MrsDowns11

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This camera sling bag is perfect for hiking! It's well made, gray on the outside and a beautiful purple on the inside. I don't stuff it with camera equipment or extra lenses, just my camera, spare SD cards, battery a couple of filters and cleaning kit in the main compartment. In the upper compartment there is room for my wallet, the ever present hand sanitizer, my keys and cell phone. I think if I wanted to carry extra lenses I would by a larger bag. But I'm keeping the weight of the pack a little lighter for hiking. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: nevadavic

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing! The seams are week
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy at the beginning, the bag has the perfect size and shape for my gear. I carry 3 lenses, a camera body with a lens installed, a speed light and batteries. Perfect bag time ended after a couple of weeks of use. One of the seams in the main compartment started to tear apart. I’ll contact Customer support and see how they respond. Update after contacting customer service: The response was very quick and they sent me a reinforced bag to try.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos B.

customer_reviews.title: My review of the sling backpack
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I feel about this yet. It’s much smaller than I expected. If you have big lenses, skip this bag. It may be good for my current needs, but I will quickly outgrow this bag. I don’t like the placement of the camera. It has no protection. Can easily fall if not opened correctly. Because of this, I may just return it. I do like that it’s sling back.
customer_reviews.author: Lety

customer_reviews.title: Love the design.  So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love this sling bag. The only thing I might change is to make a slightly larger version that can hold long telephonto lenses better. Otherwise it is well made and comfortable. It could use another external zip pocket for things like extra filters and the lens covers so when you switch lenses they are kept in a secure place till you need to use them. Right now, they are in one of two large compartments with everything else and can fall out easily. But for most cameras, is is a great bag and size.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: Good travel bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag to carry my camera on up coming trips. Its smaller size was a huge plus. The only downside is the camera pocket wastes space on the non-grip side of the camera because its shaped like a T. That being said it carries the essentials and is light weight. I will probably need something bigger when I pick up a 70-300 because other than the top pocket I don't see it fitting in this bag. I've had a few compliments on it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Yes.
customer_reviews.text: I really love this camera bag, the purple is beautiful and all the comlartments are also legit i got this with the shoulder strap holder for my camera and cannot wait to go hiking! I am incrediably happy with this and love that they have three little movable cuahions that make multiple compartments within the bag. It is an awesome camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlynn H.

customer_reviews.title: Needs more dividers
customer_reviews.text: Overall really nice, but it needs more dividers. I can only position my camera one way with a lense on with the given dividers. However, the quality, i must say, is outstanding. If your looking for something a little more flexible though, this is not the bag for you. It holds it's shape.
customer_reviews.author: smashinashli

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag! Adequate Protection!
customer_reviews.text: This bad is exactly what I needed for the Mt. Fuji climb. I didn't want to bring too many things and this bag consolidates all of my photo taking gear into one easy carry bag. The bag itself feels sturdy and the padding looks like it will offer good protection for my camera and lenses along the trail. I have a Nikon D5600 with three lenses and it fits this bag like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Kaochoy Saechao

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice well made backpack but unfortunately it was just a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice well made backpack but unfortunately it was just a little to small for my needs. It was smaller than the pictures let me to believe it really was.The camera bag I have now actuality is bigger. I wanted something that would hold all my lens and misalliances camera (STUFF) all in one bag for travel. With that said, I contacted Digital Goja, and they were more than happy to have me return it for a full refund with NO questions asked., They even paid the return postage. Digital Goja is a super seller and very customer friendly.
customer_reviews.author: John White

customer_reviews.title: Not Big Enough For Me.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this because it didn't fit everything that I wanted to fit in there. I have an 80D with a 18-135mm STM, 10-18mm STM, Sigma 18-35mm Art and 530exii flash and it didn't quite work. The should strap seems to rub too much too and I was worried about carrying for longer periods that it might irritate my skin. I ended up with the Case Logic CPL-107GY Camera Sling and that bag fits everything including my cleaning kits and misc. items! I'm sure if you are carrying less or have a smaller camera or lenses, then this bag would be fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: y2says

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for travel
customer_reviews.text: Received the bag on time and in great condition. The compartments fits my Nikon D5600 nicely (with the 55mm DX VR lens attached) without any issues. All the dividers in the main compartment are adjustable and fits all my accessories. The shoulder strap provides a comfortable carry and maintains a good balance when I'm on the move. Haven't had a chance to have any water splash on it yet so will have to update that another time. Pretty happy with it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Takes practice but doable
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough camera bag but either I’m doing something wrong, or it’s not the best bag to just sling over your shoulder if you don’t want to put on all the straps. I feel like the strap is on backwards for people who prefer slinging over the right side. 🤷🏼‍♀️ And yes, as other women have said, not the best placement for the chest strap. But overall, it’ll do.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy N.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my camera, 2 lenses, and some odds and ends.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me. I have The Nikon D5300, with a regular lens, and a 70-300mm telephoto zoom lens. Perfectly fits them, my battery charger and batteries. And a couple other little things. Compartments can be rearranged b/c all the foam pieces have string Velcro. And being the sling bag, I can Slide it around so the bag is at my chest and unzip partially to pull my camera right out to start shooting.
customer_reviews.author: castovicki

customer_reviews.title: A great bag. Comfortable, secure, easy to access
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Camera bag. It combines the features of a backpack style close body bag and a shoulder bag. It's a shoulder slung bag that snugs in close like a sling, and spins when you need access. Amazingly comfortable. Even for extended periods. Space is good, but not great. You do have to plan your day in advance as you cant fit it all. But a great bag for a full day of hiking or moving about.
customer_reviews.author: RoboGriffeyTop Contributor: Harry Potter

customer_reviews.title: Zippers broke almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: Didn't last long. I purchased it on August. Within the first month the zipper for the small pocket on top broke. The next month the zipper for the big section broke too. Cheaply made. I recommend you buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Big Time Mood

customer_reviews.title: Zippers broke within the first month
customer_reviews.text: The zippers to the two compartments came off their tracks within the first month of using it rendering this useless. Luckily none of my expensive camera gear fell out. Spend the extra money and get a brand named bag - it'll save you time and money in the long run since you'll just be purchasing a new bag after this one breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Olivier

customer_reviews.title: Not 4 telephoto’s
customer_reviews.text: Initially great design specifically because it can be slung across the chest for easier and safer access. Seems sturdy BUT it can not accommodate a telephoto lens w/wo camera attached. Too bad because adding an inch or 1,5” in width would have solved this problem/issue
customer_reviews.author: Jake

product_meta.title: Altura Photo Camera Sling Backpack Bag for DSLR and Mirrorless Cameras (Canon Nikon Sony Pentax)
product_meta.description:
Altura Photo Camera Sling Backpack for DSLR Cameras 

ADAPTABLE STORAGE 
Our lightweight, durable camera backpack is ready for all your daily escapades! Adjustable, padded dividers allow you to customize the main compartment to the various combinations of cameras and lenses you might pick to accompany you on your daily adventures. The top compartment above it holds flashes and other accessories, while the zippered interior pockets in both compartments keep batteries and cards safe and sound. It even has a tripod holder on the side. 

COMFORT AND CONVENIENT ACCESS 
The soft, padded, cross-body strap wears comfortably and can be rotated to bring the bag to the front of the body. This - and the zippered side opening - allows you quick and easy access to your travel companions without removing the bag. 

Features 
- Curved, padded sling strap allows bag to rotate to front of body without removing 
- Designed to fit DSLR cameras and lenses, mirrorless cameras, DJI Mavic Pro Drone and accessories 
- Side-zippered main compartment with customizable, sturdy, padded dividers 
- Top compartment for flashes and other shooting essentials 
- Mesh interior pockets for smaller items 
- Tripod/monopod holder on exterior 
- Dimensions: 8.5" x 5.5" x 16" (LxWxH) 

Compatibilities 
Compatible with Canon, Nikon, Sony, Olympus, Pentax and other DSLRs and photographic equipment.
feature_bullets: ADJUSTABLE PADDED DIVIDERS: Main compartment has sturdy, padded, adjustable dividers. Holds DSLR cameras with a standard zoom lens.
QUICK ACCESS SIDE OPENING: Main compartment has convenient zippered side opening.
PADDED SLING STRAP ROTATES TO FRONT: The comfort sling design allows for quick rotation from the back to the front of your body, giving you easy and fast access to your gear.
ACCESSORY STORAGE: Top compartment allows you to fit extra lenses or flash units. Exterior tripod/monopod holder. Zippered mesh pockets in both compartments.
SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: Backed with Digital Goja 90-Day 100% Satisfaction Guarantee.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,751 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
